meanings.definition: The quality of being suitable for consumption as food.
meanings.sent1: The edibility of the fruit was evident from its fresh appearance.
meanings.sent2: It is important to consider the edibility of mushrooms before picking them in the wild.
meanings.sent3: The chef joked about the edibility of his burnt toast, claiming it was a new culinary trend.
meanings.sent4: The edibility of the fish was questionable, so the diner decided to order something else.
meanings.sent5: The edibility of the berries was confirmed by the expert foragers in the group.

meanings.definition: The state of being safe to eat.
meanings.sent1: Before trying a new dish, always check the edibility of the ingredients.
meanings.sent2: The edibility of the canned food was assured by the expiration date.
meanings.sent3: The comedian joked about the edibility of his cooking, claiming it was so bad even the dog refused it.
meanings.sent4: The edibility of the street food was a concern for the tourists, so they opted for a restaurant instead.
meanings.sent5: The edibility of the meat was confirmed by the clear instructions on the packaging.
